Title: Confirm TSA, medical, logbook and IDs
Notes: Verify TSA approval, medical certificate, passport or ID, and old logbook are all located and packed.

Title: Review KFXE local procedures and maps
Notes: Study KFXE charts, taxi routes, noise abatement, pattern altitudes and local practice areas.

Title: Set up oral prep binder and apps
Notes: Create a digital binder with sections for regulations, airspace, weather, performance, systems and cross-country planning.

Title: First dual recurrency flight
Notes: Focus on basic maneuvers, stalls, slow flight, patterns and radio work with CFI.

Title: Second dual recurrency flight
Notes: Fly more stalls, steep turns, emergencies and pattern work to rebuild confidence and precision.

Title: Third dual recurrency flight
Notes: Polish takeoffs and landings, short-field and soft-field techniques and traffic pattern entries and exits.

Title: First dual cross-country and hood time
Notes: Fly a short dual cross-country and log at least 0.3 to 0.5 hours under the hood for instrument practice.

Title: Pre-solo review with CFI
Notes: Demonstrate safe patterns, landings and basic maneuvers and review the pre-solo written test with your instructor.

Title: CFI solo endorsement signed (goal)
Notes: Aim to complete 61.87 requirements and obtain the first solo endorsement in the C172.

Title: Oral prep: regulations and pilot privileges
Notes: Review 61.103, 61.105, 61.109, 91.103, 91.205, 91.213 and private pilot privileges and limitations.

Title: Oral prep: airspace and VFR weather minimums
Notes: Memorize airspace classes, entry requirements, cloud clearances and visibility minimums for day and night.

Title: Reach 2 hours of dual instrument time
Notes: Use hood time on dual flights to approach at least 2.0 hours of simulated instrument in the logbook.

Title: Finish required 3 hours of dual cross-country
Notes: Ensure the logbook shows at least 3.0 hours of cross-country dual instruction under 61.109.

Title: Oral prep: performance and weight and balance
Notes: Practice takeoff and landing distance, climb performance and full weight and balance problems for the C172.

Title: Complete 3 hours instrument and 3 hours night
Notes: Log a total of 3.0 hours simulated instrument and 3.0 hours night dual including 100 NM night cross-country and 10 full-stop night landings.

Title: Oral prep: systems and emergencies
Notes: Review engine, fuel, electrical, pitot static and vacuum systems plus all emergency checklists and memory items.

Title: Reach 3 hours of solo local practice
Notes: Fly solo patterns and local area maneuvers toward at least 3.0 hours of solo local time.

Title: Complete towered solo full-stop landings
Notes: Log three solo full-stop landings at a towered airport such as KFLL, KPBI or KMIA.

Title: Plan and brief 150 NM solo cross-country
Notes: With CFI, choose the route, calculate performance and fuel, brief airspace, alternates and NOTAMs for the long solo cross-country.

Title: Fly 150 NM solo cross-country
Notes: Complete one solo cross-country of at least 150 NM total distance with three full-stop landings and one leg over 50 NM.

Title: Reach 5 hours of solo cross-country time
Notes: Add additional solo cross-country as needed so the logbook shows at least 5.0 hours of solo cross-country.

Title: Full mock oral exam with CFI
Notes: Simulate a full checkride oral including regulations, systems, weather, cross-country plan and performance calculations.

Title: PPL checkride target date
Notes: Arrive early with logbook, endorsements, knowledge test report, medical certificate and aircraft documents.

Title: PPL checkride backup date
Notes: Use this date only if the earlier checkride was delayed due to weather or aircraft issues.

Title: Start IFR ground school and simulator block
Notes: Begin structured IFR study and simulator work focusing on attitude instrument flying and basic radio procedures.

Title: IFR milestone: basic attitude and scan solid
Notes: Be comfortable flying by reference to instruments only and recovering from unusual attitudes.

Title: IFR milestone: holds and approach basics
Notes: Get initial training in holding patterns, vectors to final and basic precision and nonprecision approaches.

Title: IFR mid course review with CFII
Notes: Review IFR hours and proficiency with your instructor and adjust the remaining schedule before the end of the trip.

Title: First complex aircraft CPL style lesson
Notes: Fly complex aircraft and learn gear, propeller and new system procedures plus commercial style maneuvers.

Title: CPL path and hour planning meeting
Notes: Meet with the school to define remaining CPL requirements and plan for the next training phase.

Title: Return travel and archive training documents
Notes: Export the electronic logbook, scan endorsements and store all training documents in cloud backup and local copies.
